text:
Ronald William Miller (April 17, 1933 – February 9, 2019) was an American businessman and professional American football player. He was President and CEO of The Walt Disney Company from 1978 to 1984 and was president of the board of directors of the Walt Disney Family Museum.
Miller was the son-in-law of Walt Disney. Miller played for the Los Angeles Rams in 1956.
Miller died on February 9, 2019 in Los Angeles, California from congestive heart failure, aged 85.
